level.heading: CONTENTS OF THE INDIVIDUAL SERVICE PLAN (ยง 29-6259)

level.text: The initial and comprehensive ISP shall:
Include the strengths and needs assessment;
State the goals to be achieved and evaluate the resident’s skill level for each goal;
State the timeframes projected for meeting the goals;

Describe the activities and services, including but not limited to daily, educational, counseling, recreational, vocational, mental health, and medical activities or services, including the prescription of psychotropic or other medications, that will be provided and who will provide them;
Describe proposed involvement, visitation and communication with family and others;
Set forth a discharge or transfer plan, where applicable;
Describe the objectives and methods to be used to evaluate the resident’s progress;
Identify the person(s) responsible for coordinating and implementing the ISP;
Be consistent with any court orders;
Be consistent with the contracting entity and, where applicable, the CSSD’s plans for the resident;
State the treatment goals and interim objectives, services, and treatment to be provided for each goal, the projected times for achieving each goal, and the responsible service providers; and
Identify criteria by which to assess the resident’s progress and to determine when each treatment goal has been achieved.
